pages.text: $(br)Spawners no longer spawn mobs infinitely. They now have a $(key)"Remaining Spawn Count"$() â€” when it reaches zero, the spawner stops spawning and $(bold)self-destructs$().$(br2)Naturally generated spawners have a default count of $(bold)20$().$(br2)You can use $(mage/spell#summon)Mana Summon$() to $(bold)reset$() a spawner's remaining spawn count.

$(br)When a spawner is $(bold)manually$() broken, it drops a $(key)Spawner Soul$(), which is an important crafting material for some items.$(br2)You can also use a $(key)Spawner Soul$() as an $(bold)index item$() for $(mage/spell#summon)Mana Summon$() to put it back into a spawner.
